timeline.message: gh-2259 FederatedStore test for infinite loop
gh-2259 FederatedStore will not return graphs more than once for the same operation.
gh-2259 FederatedStore will not return graphs more than once for the same operation.

timeline.bodyText: Is there any value in keeping this signature as an overload, and perhaps adding one for getGraphs(user)?
timeline.author: t11947
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -334,10 +350,23 @@ public Schema getSchema(final Map<String, String> config, final User user) {
      *
      * @param user        the users scope to get graphs for.
      * @param graphIdsCsv the csv of graphIds to get, null returns all graphs.
+     * @param operation   the requesting operation.
      * @return the graph collection.
      */
-    public Collection<Graph> getGraphs(final User user, final String graphIdsCsv) {

replies.bodyText:
I don't think it would or should be used anywhere.
The graphIdsCsv is optional value from operations during federation, ignoring this will ignore the users request to scope the operation.
Removing the the Operation parameter will remove the attempt to mitigate infinite loops, making this ticket change potentially useless.
replies.author: GCHQDev404

timeline.bodyText: Re-add old method to maintain public api. Old tests should be reverted and should pass.
timeline.author: d47853
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -328,16 +349,45 @@ public Schema getSchema(final Map config, final User user) { * given csv of graphIds, with visibility of the given user. *

*

+ * Graphs are returned once per operation, this does not allow an infinite loop of FederatedStores to occur. + *

+ *

* if graphIdsCsv is null then all graph objects within FederatedStore * scope are returned. *

* * @param user the users scope to get graphs for. * @param graphIdsCsv the csv of graphIds to get, null returns all graphs. + * @param operation the requesting operation, graphs are returned only once per operation. * @return the graph collection. */ - public Collection getGraphs(final User user, final String graphIdsCsv) { - return graphStorage.get(user, getCleanStrings(graphIdsCsv)); + public Collection getGraphs(final User user, final String graphIdsCsv, final Operation operation) {

replies.bodyText:
If that is done, then all infinate loop mitigation can be completely bypassed.
You will be completely reliant on at least 1 FederatedStore in the loop being standard with standard handlers.
replies.author: GCHQDev404

replies.bodyText: Ah okay. Fair enough. To be safe though, it would be a good idea to re-add it and deprecate it with a comment on why it shouldn't be used.
replies.author: d47853

replies.bodyText:
Any handers already written will continue to use the deprecated by passed method.
And will not be changed until the deprecation is removed.
I prefer to force the change to make them update. Are you happy with mitigation reliant on 1 FederatedStore?
replies.author: GCHQDev404

replies.bodyText: I guess as the Federated Store is labeled experimental and this mitigates a serious bug, as you say, it's probably better to force the change.
replies.author: d47853

timeline.bodyText: Does this mean that two FederatedStores in seperate JVMs could have the same id?
timeline.author: d47853

replies.bodyText: Yes, but collision is chance is very low. This is to mitigate against infinite loops not guarantee it doesn't ever happen. Next time one of the JVM is turned on and off again it should be okay.
replies.author: GCHQDev404

timeline.author: d47853

replies.bodyText: Sorry my question wasn't very clear. I was more referring to the final part of the ternary where you wrap the options in a hashmap. I don't think it needs the extra wrap as you've already don a null check.
replies.author: d47853

replies.bodyText:
regarding new HashMap<>(operation.getOptions())?
This is because the operations interface makes each operation responsible for creating and returning the options map. It might be immutable.
replies.author: GCHQDev404

timeline.author: d47853

replies.bodyText: Coz I was looking for a put() method which wasn't there since I was dealing with properties map.
replies.author: GCHQDev404

timeline.bodyText: Is it worth hoisting the Random object to stop it being created every loop, and instantiating i to a random int off the bat to prevent the need for a null check?
timeline.author: t11947

replies.bodyText:
99% of the time the loop will happen once.
It will require storing an additional variable for a simple loop.
Do you wish me to make the change?
replies.author: GCHQDev404

replies.bodyText: Is there a reason you're not assigning the value right away rather than assigning null and then checking for null?
replies.author: t11947

replies.bodyText:
Because if there is collision I will need to rewrite the logic to assign the value again. which means duplicate line of code.
variable = assign value logic
check(variable)
variable = re-assign logic again // duplicate code.
replies.author: GCHQDev404

replies.bodyText: If you're worried about code duplication, consider using a private method. Is there a reason you're not assigning to the field directly from the get go?
replies.author: t11947
GCHQDev404

timeline.bodyText: Consider not using constant case for mutable lists.
timeline.author: t11947

replies.bodyText:
This is global list held and modified by all classes, to understand and know which ID number have been used by other classes.
What would you consider using?
replies.author: GCHQDev404

replies.bodyText: Camel case for mutable class members.
replies.author: t11947

replies.bodyText:
OOooooooh completely misunderstood  you.
I don't think you've selected the correct naming convention.
-> "error: Name 'allIds' must match pattern '^[A-Z][A-Z0-9"
replies.author: GCHQDev404
